CatDescriptText: Gwendolyn Hampton, presser, 528 Kearns Avenue, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, November 21, 1959, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think that the steel strike will be resumed after the 80-day 'cooling-off' period imposed by the Supreme Court under the injection of the Taft-Hartley Act?" answer reads: "Yes, I really do. I think that it's right and the men should stick to what they want."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Gwendolyn Hampton wearing light colored coat with knotted belt and dark plush lining, ring, and earrings, standing on sidewalk, possibly Downtown
